file_content.text: Everyone's talking about how you took down Master Fraal. It's an honor.
Here for inoculation? You'll need form 1423-D, and uh... oh, excuse me.
Sorry, my lord. I thought you were another recruit. No paperwork required.
My apologies, sir. Your clearance doesn't require paperwork.
Mercs volunteer all the time, but few have your reputation. Let's forget the red tape.
Sorry, thought you were new recruits. I'm authorized to fast-track special candidates.
I take it you're here to fight in the Quesh war?
Just point me towards the battle.
That's right.
This planet generally doesn't inspire excitement.
What war?
War?
Sorry--thought you'd been briefed. I can't talk about military operations. Let's just say it's a hazardous fight.
My business is my own.
Understood. Whatever your interests, just know that this planet's not safe.
Quesh is highly toxic, poisoned by the resource the Republic's mining. You'll need a protective injection just to survive.
There we go. That treatment will protect you, for the time being.
I have business on Quesh.
Are we done here?
You're good to go. The effects will wear off, but you can get another injection planetside.
The protection wears off?
For the time being?
Stick me again, and I'll give you my signature treatment.
Keep your needles to yourself.
I'm sorry, I--I was just following protocol.
The effects will fade eventually, but you can receive more treatments planetside.
You're cleared. Talk to Moff Dracen if you want to fight; he's in charge of the Empire's war effort.
No one reaches Quesh without inoculation. Moff Dracen's orders.
Quesh is a brutal planet. Good luck down there.
